abstract: We construct an infinite family of hyperbolic 3-manifolds whose fundamental groups are cyclically presented. We prove that these 3-manifolds are cyclic branched coverings of S 3 over the 2-bridge knot b(17,4). Finally, we compute thehomology groups and discuss the spines of our manifolds which correspond to some group presentations.

title: Convolution Rings
abstract: The notion of a convolution type is introduced. Imposing such a type on a ring gives the corresponding convolution ring. Under this umbrella, a wide variety of ring constructions can be covered, including polynomials, matrices, incidence algebras, necklace rings, group rings and quaternion rings. Here the influence of the convolution type on the corresponding convolution ring is investigated, in particular on the existence of homomorphisms and ideals.

title: The Fischer‚ÄìClifford Matrices of a Maximal Subgroup of the Sporadic Simple Group of Held
abstract: The Held group He discovered by Held [10] is a sporadic simple group of order 4030387200 = 2 10 .3 3 .5 2 .7 3 .17. The group He has 11 conjugacy classes of maximal subgroups as determined by Butler [5] and listed in the ùî∏ùïãùïÉùî∏ùïä. Held himself determined much of the local structure of He as well as the conjugacy classes of its elements. Thompson calculated the character table of He . In the present paper, we determine the Fischer‚ÄìClifford matrices and hence compute the character table of the non-split extension 3¬∑S 7 , which is a maximal subgroups of He of index 226560 using the technique of Fischer‚ÄìClifford matrices. Most of the computations were carried out with the aid of the computer algebra system ùîæùî∏‚Ñô.

title: On the Efficiency of the Direct Products of Monogenic Monoids
authors: Hayrullah Ayƒ±k; C. M. Campbell; John O'Connor
abstract: We give necessary and sufficient conditions for the efficiency of the direct product of finitely many finite monogenic monoids.

title: Induced Modules of Semisimple Hopf Algebras
abstract: Let K be a field. Let H be a finite-dimensional K-Hopf algebra and D(H) be the Drinfel'd double of H. In this paper, we study Radford's induced module H Œ≤ , where Œ≤ is a group-like element in H ‚àó . Using the commuting pair established in [7], we obtain an analogue of the class equation for [Formula: see text] when H is semisimple and cosemisimple. In case H is a finite group algebra or a factorizable semisimple cosemisimple Hopf algebra, we give an explicit decomposition of each H Œ≤ into a direct sum of simple D(H)-modules.

title: Generalized Regular Sequence and Finiteness of Local Cohomology Modules
abstract: Let R be a commutative Noetherian local ring, ùîû an ideal of R, and M a finitely generated generalized f-module. Let t be a positive integer such that [Formula: see text] and t > dim M - dim M/ùîûM. In this paper, we prove that there exists an ideal ùîü ‚äá ùîû such that (1) dim M - dim M/ùîüM = t; and (2) the natural homomorphism [Formula: see text] is an isomorphism for all i > t and it is surjective for i = t. Also, we show that if [Formula: see text] is a finite set for all i < t, then there exists an ideal ùîü of R such that dim R/ùîü ‚â§ 1 and [Formula: see text] for all i < t.

title: Band Congruences of t-Archimedean Ordered Semigroups
abstract: Some semigroups without order are decomposable into t-archimedean semigroups via bands. In this paper, we deal with the decomposition of some ordered semigroups into t-archimedean components. The semilattice congruences play an important role in studying the decomposition of semigroups without order. When we pass from semigroups without order to ordered semigroups, the same role is played by the complete semilattice congruences. The characterization of complete semilattices of ordered semigroups of a given type has been considered by the same authors. The r- and l-band congruences have been proved to be useful in studying the decomposition of some types of ordered semigroups, especially the decomposition of r- and l-archimedean ordered semigroups. Band congruences have been proved to be useful in studying the decomposition of some types of ordered semigroups into t-archimedean (ordered) semigroups. The characterization of the bands of ordered semigroups of a given type [Formula: see text] has been recently considered by the same authors. In this paper, we characterize the bands of t-archimedean ordered semigroups. As a result we get a decomposition of some ordered semigroups into t-archimedean components. The decomposition we obtain is uniquely defined.

title: Maximal Congruences on Some Semigroups
abstract: In 1976 Howie proved that a finite congruence-free semigroup is a simple group if it has at least three elements but no zero element. Infinite congruence-free semigroups are far more complicated to describe, but some have been constructed using semigroups of transformations (for example, by Howie in 1981 and by Marques in 1983). Here, for certain semigroups S of numbers and of transformations, we determine all congruences œÅ on S such that S/œÅ is congruence-free, that is, we describe all maximal congruences on such semigroups S.

title: A Structure Theorem of Regular ${\cal H}^\sharp$-Cryptographs
authors: Xiangzhi Kong; Zhiling Yuan; K. P. Shum
abstract: A new set of generalized Green relations is given in studying the [Formula: see text]-abundant semigroups. By using the generalized strong semilattice of semigroups recently developed by the authors, we show that an [Formula: see text]-abundant semigroup is a regular [Formula: see text]-cryptograph if and only if it is an [Formula: see text]-strong semilattice of completely [Formula: see text]-simple semigroups. This result not only extends the well known result of Petrich and Reilly from the class of completely regular semigroups to the class of semiabundant semigroups, but also generalizes a well known result of Fountain on superabundant semigroups from the class of abundant semigroups to the class of semiabundant semigroups.

title: On œÄ-Regular Rings with Involution
abstract: A ring R is œÄ-regular if for every a in R, there is a positive integer n such that a n R is generated by an idempotent. In this paper, we introduce the notion of œÄ-*-regular rings, which is the *-version of œÄ-regular rings. We prove various properties of œÄ-*-regular rings, and establish many equivalent characterizations of abelian œÄ-*-regular rings.

title: Finite p-Groups Whose Subgroups of Given Order Are Isomorphic and Minimal Non-abelian
abstract: Finite p-groups whose subgroups of given order are isomorphic and minimal non-abelian are classified. In addition, two results on a chain condition of ùíú t -groups are improved.

title: Spanning Simplicial Complex of Wheel Graph Wn
authors: Aqsa Zahid; Muhammad Umer Saleem; Agha Kashif; Muhammad Wahab Khan; Mohsin Meraj; Rida Irfan
abstract: In this paper, we explore the spanning simplicial complex of wheel graph W n on vertex set [n]. Combinatorial properties of the spanning simplicial complex of wheel graph are discussed, which are then used to compute the f-vector and Hilbert series of face ring k[Œî s (W n )] for the spanning simplicial complex Œî s (W n ). Moreover, the associated primes of the facet ideal [Formula: see text] are also computed.

title: Left-Symmetric Algebra Structures on the Planar Galilean Conformal Algebra
abstract: In this paper, we mainly determine the compatible left-symmetric algebra structures on the planar Galilean conformal algebra with some natural grading conditions. The results of earlier work on left-symmetric algebra structures on the twisted Heisenberg-Virasoro algebra play an important role in determining these compatible structures. As a corollary, any such left-symmetric algebra contains an infinite-dimensional non-trivial subalgebra that is also a submodule of the regular module.

title: Relative Canonical Modules and Some Duality Results
abstract: Let (R, m) be a relative Cohen‚ÄìMacaulay local ring with respect to an ideal a of R and set c to be ht a. We investigate some properties of the Matlis dual of the R-module [Formula: see text], and we show that such modules behave like canonical modules over Cohen‚ÄìMacaulay local rings. Moreover, we provide some duality and equivalence results with respect to the module [Formula: see text], and these results lead us to achieve generalizations of some known results, such as the local duality theorem, which have been provided over a Cohen‚ÄìMacaulay local ring admiting a canonical R-module.

title: On a Class of Constacyclic Codes of Length 4ps over Fpm[u]„Äà ua „Äâ
authors: Hai Q. Dinh; Bac T. Nguyen; Songsak Sriboonchitta
abstract: For any odd prime p such that p m ‚â° 3 (mod 4), consider all units Œõ of the finite commutative chain ring [Formula: see text] that have the form Œõ = Œõ 0 + uŒõ 1 + ‚ãØ + u a‚àí1 Œõ a‚àí1 , where Œõ 0 , Œõ 1 , ‚Ä¶, Œõ a‚àí1 ‚àä ùîΩ p m, Œõ 0 ‚â† 0, Œõ 1 ‚â† 0. The class of Œõ-constacyclic codes of length 4p s over ‚Ñõ a is investigated. If the unit Œõ is a square, each Œõ-constacyclic code of length 4p s is expressed as a direct sum of a ‚àíŒª-constacyclic code and a Œª-constacyclic code of length 2p s . In the main case that the unit Œõ is not a square, we prove that the polynomial x 4 ‚àí Œª 0 can be decomposed as a product of two quadratic irreducible and monic coprime factors, where [Formula: see text]. From this, the ambient ring [Formula: see text] is proven to be a principal ideal ring, whose maximal ideals are ‚ü®x 2 + 2Œ∑x + 2Œ∑ 2 ‚ü© and ‚ü®x 2 ‚àí 2Œ∑x + 2Œ∑ 2 ‚ü©, where Œª 0 = ‚àí4Œ∑ 4 . We also give the unique self-dual Type 1 Œõ-constacyclic codes of length 4p s over ‚Ñõ a . Furthermore, conditions for a Type 1 Œõ-constacyclic code to be self-orthogonal and dual-containing are provided.

title: Properties of the Secondary Hochschild Homology
abstract: In this paper we study properties of the secondary Hochschild homology of the triple (A, B, Œµ) with coefficients in M. We establish a type of Morita equivalence between two triples and show that H ‚Ä¢ ((A, B, Œµ); M) is invariant under this equivalence. We also prove the existence of an exact sequence which connects the usual and the secondary Hochschild homologies in low dimension, allowing one to perform easy computations. The functoriality of H ‚Ä¢ ((A, B, Œµ); M) is also discussed.

title: Unitary Modules for the Twisted Heisenberg‚ÄìVirasoro Algebra
authors: Xiufu Zhang; Shaobin Tan; Haifeng Lian
abstract: The conjugate-linear anti-involutions and unitary irreducible modules of the intermediate series over the twisted Heisenberg‚ÄìVirasoro algebra are classified, respectively. We prove that any unitary irreducible module of the intermediate series over the twisted Heisenberg‚ÄìVirasoro algebra is of the form [Formula: see text] for [Formula: see text], [Formula: see text] and [Formula: see text].

title: Quantum Weyl Polynomials and the Center of the Quantum Group U<sub>q</sub>(ùî∞ùî©<sub>3</sub>)
authors: Libin Li; Jingyan Wu; Meiling Zhu
abstract: In this paper, we show that the center of the quantum group U q (ùî∞ùî© 3 ) is the subalgebra of U q (ùî∞ùî© 3 ) generated by three elements, and isomorphic to a quotient algebra of the polynomial algebra with three variables and one relation.

title: Two-parameter Quantum Affine Algebra $U_{r,s}(\widehat{\frak{sl}}_2)$
abstract: We give two realizations of the two-parameter quantum affine algebra [Formula: see text] and prove that its structure is isomorphic to the one-parameter case. In particular, the evaluation representation of [Formula: see text] is obtained.

title: Characterization of <font>Aut</font>(J<sub>2</sub>) and <font>Aut</font>(M<sup>c</sup>L) by Their Non-commuting Graphs
abstract: For a non-abelian group G, we associate the non-commuting graph ‚àá (G) whose vertex set is G\Z(G) with two vertices x and y joined by an edge whenever the commutator of x and y is not the identity. In this paper, we prove that Aut (J 2 ) and Aut (M c L) are characterized by their non-commuting graphs.

title: On Duo Group Rings
abstract: It is shown that if the group ring RQ 8 of the quaternion group Q 8 of order 8 over an integral domain R is duo, then R is a field for the following cases: (1) char R ‚â† 0, and (2) char R = 0 and S ‚äÜ R ‚äÜ K S , where S is a ring of algebraic integers and K S is its quotient field. Hence, we confirm that the field ‚Ñö of rational numbers is the smallest integral domain R of characteristic zero such that RQ 8 is duo. A non-field integral domain R of characteristic zero for which RQ 8 is duo is also identified. Moreover, we give a description of when the group ring RG of a torsion group G is duo.

title: Note on Lattice-ordered Rings with Positive Squares
abstract: Bourbaki, Birkhoff-Pierce and Fuchs pointed out or showed that a lattice-ordered field in which each square is positive must be totally ordered. Yang proved that a lattice-ordered ring R is a totally ordered skew-field if and only if every strictly positive element of R is invertible and each square in R is positive. In this note, we construct a simple example to explain the difference between order-isomorphisms and lattice-isomorphisms, and show that the difference can be dropped in lattice-ordered rings. Especially, this yields an extension and an elementary proof of the main theorem in Yang's paper.

title: Finite Nilpotent Groups Having Exactly Four Conjugacy Classes of Non-normal Subgroups
authors: L√º Gong; Cao Hong-ping; Guiyun Chen
abstract: Finite nilpotent groups having exactly four conjugacy classes of non-normal subgroups are classified.

title: Adjacency Matrices of PSL(2,5) and Resemblance of Its Coset Diagrams with Fullerene C<sub>60</sub>
abstract: The action of PSL(2,‚Ñ§) on PL(F 5 n ) yields PSL(2,5). In this paper, we use the adjacency matrices of the abstract group PSL(2,5), eventually of fullerene C 60 , to draw the coset diagram and investigate various properties of the diagram with reference to the intransitivity of the action and the number of orbits.

title: On the Structure of Augmentation Quotient Groups for the Generalized Quaternion Group
abstract: For the generalized quaternion group G, this article deals with the problem of presenting the nth power Œî n (G) of the augmentation ideal Œî (G) of the integral group ring ZG. The structure of Q n (G)=Œî n (G)/Œî n+1 (G) is obtained.

title: On n-Isoclinic Pairs of Groups
abstract: In this paper, we extend the notion of n-isoclinism to the class of all pairs of groups (G,M), where M is a normal subgroup of a group G. The details of that notion are studied and some equivalent conditions are given for two pairs of groups to be n-isoclinic. In addition, the concept of subgroup- and quotient-irreducibility for a pair of groups is defined and we derive how to see whether (G,M) has a pair of subgroups or a pair of factor groups n-isoclinic with (G,M).

title: Determinantal Representation of Outer Inverses in Riemannian Space
authors: Predrag S. Stanimiroviƒá; Milan Lj. Zlatanoviƒá
abstract: Starting from a known determinantal representation of outer inverses, we derive their determinantal representation in terms of the inner product in the Euclidean space. We define the double inner product of two miscellaneous tensors of rank 2 in a Riemannian space. The corresponding determinantal representation as well as the general representation of outer inverses in the Riemannian space are derived. A non-zero {2}-inverse X of a given tensor A obeying œÅ(X) = s with 1 ‚â§ s ‚â§ r = œÅ(A) is expressed in terms of the double inner product involving compound tensors with minors of order s, extracted from A and appropriate tensors.

title: Canonical Forms and Infimum of Positive Braids
authors: Usman Ali; Zaffar Iqbal; Shaheen Nazir
abstract: In this paper, we prove that a subset of the non-commutative Gr√∂bner basis for the braid group given by Bokut is a basis for the braid monoid in band generators. We give an inductive way of computing the infimum of a positive braid and hence a criteria to decide whether a positive word is prime to the fundamental braid or not. We also compute the Hilbert series of the braid monoid with three generators.

title: Cleanness of the Group Ring of an Abelian p-Group over a Commutative Ring
abstract: A ring R is called clean if every element is the sum of an idempotent and a unit, while R is called uniquely clean if this representation is unique. In this article, we prove that if R is a commutative ring and G is an abelian p-group with p in J(R), then RG is clean if and only if R is clean. Moreover, when G is a locally finite group, some conditions for RG to be uniquely clean are given.

title: The Upper Radical Property and Lower Radical Property of Groups
abstract: We take in this paper an arbitrary class [Formula: see text] of groups as a base, and define a radical property ùí´ for which every group in [Formula: see text] is ùí´-semisimple. This is called the upper radical property determined by the class [Formula: see text]. At the same time, we define a radical property ùí´ for which every group in [Formula: see text] is a ùí´-radical group. This is called the first lower radical property determined by the class [Formula: see text]. Also, we give another construction leading to the second lower radical property which is proved to be identical with the first one.

title: Symmetric Elements of Nonlinear Involutions in Group Rings
abstract: Given an involution œÜ : G ‚Üí G in a group G and a ring R, we study the extensions, not necessarily linear, to an involution œà : RG ‚Üí RG in the group ring RG. We investigate the symmetric elements, those Œ± ‚àà RG for which œà(Œ±) = Œ±, and give necessary and sufficient conditions for the set of symmetric elements, (RG) œà , to be a subring of RG. This work is a generalization of [6] and references therein where only linear extensions of the group involution are considered.

title: Complete Intersection Flat Dimension and the Intersection Theorem
authors: Parviz Sahandi; Tirdad Sharif; Siamak Yassemi
abstract: Any finitely generated module M over a local ring R is endowed with a complete intersection dimension CI-dim R M and a Gorenstein dimension G-dim R M. The Gorenstein dimension can be extended to all modules over the ring R. This paper presents a similar extension for the complete intersection dimension, and mentions the relation between this dimension and the Gorenstein flat dimension. In addition, we show that in the intersection theorem, the flat dimension can be replaced by the complete intersection flat dimension.

title: Contragredient Modules and Invariant Bilinear Forms on M√∂bius Nonlocal Vertex Algebras
abstract: We study contragredient modules for M√∂bius nonlocal vertex algebras and characterize the space of all invariant bilinear forms on M√∂bius nonlocal vertex algebras. Finally, M√∂bius weak quantum vertex algebras of Zamolodchikov-Faddeev type are studied as examples.

title: Non-singular Equations over Groups I
abstract: Let G be a group, t an element distinct from G and r(t)= g 1 t l 1 ‚ãØ g k t l k ‚àà G ‚àó „Äàt „Äâ, where each g i is an element of G of order greater than 2 and the l i are non-zero integers such that l 1 +l 2 + ‚ãØ +l k ‚â† 0 and |l i | ‚â† |l j | for i ‚â† j. It is known that if k‚â§ 2, then the natural map from G to the one-relator product „ÄàG,t | r(t)„Äâ is injective. In this paper, we prove that the same holds for all k ‚àâ {4, 5}.

title: A Combinatorial Approach to Specht Module Cohomology
abstract: For a Specht module S Œª for the symmetric group Œ£ d , the cohomology H i (Œ£ d ,S Œª ) is known only in degree i = 0. We give a combinatorial criterion equivalent to the nonvanishing of the degree i = 1 cohomology, valid in odd characteristic. Our condition generalizes James' solution in degree zero. We apply this combinatorial description to give some computations of Specht module cohomology, together with an explicit description of the corresponding modules. Finally, we suggest some general conjectures that might be particularly amenable to proof using this description.

title: Finite Groups with Some Subgroups of Given Order
authors: Jiangtao Shi; Cui Zhang; Dengfeng Liang
abstract: Let [Formula: see text] be the class of groups of non-prime-power order or the class of groups of prime-power order. In this paper we give a complete classification of finite non-solvable groups with a quite small number of conjugacy classes of [Formula: see text]-subgroups or classes of [Formula: see text]-subgroups of the same order.

title: Subalgebras of the Lie Algebra of the Derivations on a Torus and Their Representations
abstract: We study a class of subalgebras of the Lie algebra of the derivations on a torus. We construct a functor F Œ± from linear Lie algebra modules to these subalgebra modules. We then characterize the structure of the image modules of corresponding linear Lie algebra modules under this functor.

title: Notes on the Drinfeld Double of Finite-dimensional Group Algebras
abstract: Let k be an algebraically closed field of characteristic p > 0. We characterize the finite groups G for which the Drinfeld double D(kG) of the group algebra kG has the Chevalley property. We also show that this is the case if and only if the tensor product of every simple D(kG)-module with its dual is semisimple. The analogous result for the group algebra kG is also true, but its proof requires the classification of the finite simple groups. A further result concerns the largest Hopf ideal contained in the Jacobson radical of D(kG). We prove that this is generated by the augmentation ideal of kO p (Z(G)), where Z(G) is the center of G and O p (Z(G)) the largest p-subgroup of this center.

title: On Efficient Presentations for Infinite Sequences of 2-Groups with Fixed Coclass
abstract: Eick and Leedham-Green introduced infinite sequences of finite p-groups of fixed coclass. They showed that the groups in such an infinite sequence can be defined by a single parametrised presentation. Our aim is to construct short or even efficient parametrised presentations for such infinite sequences of finite 2-groups.

title: Co-commutators with Generalized Derivations on Lie Ideals in Prime Rings
abstract: Let R be a prime ring of characteristic different from 2, L a noncentral Lie ideal of R, H and G two nonzero generalized derivations of R. Suppose u s (H(u)u-uG(u)) u t =0 for all u ‚àà L, where s, t ‚â• 0 are fixed integers. Then either (i) there exists p ‚àà U such that H(x)=xp for all x ‚àà R and G(x)=px for all x ‚àà R unless R satisfies S 4 , the standard identity in four variables; or (ii) R satisfies S 4 and there exist p, q ‚àà U such that H(x)=px+xq for all x ‚àà R and G(x)=qx+xp for all x ‚àà R.

title: Symmetrizable Intersection Matrix Lie Algebras
abstract: Associated to every symmetrizable generalized intersection matrix A, we define a Lie algebra, called an SIM-Lie algebra. We prove that SIM-Lie algebras keep unchange under braid-equivalences. Two special cases are considered. In the case when A is a symmetrizable generalized Cartan matrix, we show that the corresponding SIM-Lie algebra is just the Kac‚ÄìMoody Lie algebra. In another case when A is an intersection matrix, we prove that the corresponding SIM-Lie algebra is just the intersection matrix Lie algebra in the sense of Slodowy.

title: Lie Bialgebra Structures on the Extended Schr√∂dinger-Virasoro Lie Algebra
authors: Lamei Yuan; Yongping Wu; Ying Xu
abstract: In this paper, Lie bialgebra structures on the extended Schr√∂dinger-Virasoro Lie algebra [Formula: see text] are classified. It is obtained that all the Lie bialgebra structures on [Formula: see text] are triangular coboundary. As a by-product, it is derived that the first cohomology group [Formula: see text] is trivial.

title: Simple Deformed Witt Algebras
abstract: For any unique factorization domain [Formula: see text] and an algebra endomorphism œÉ of [Formula: see text], there exists a non-associative algebra [Formula: see text] with multiplication satisfying skew-symmetry and generalized (twisted) Jacobi identities, called a œÉ-deformed Witt algebra. In this paper, we obtain necessary and sufficient conditions for the algebra [Formula: see text] to be simple.

title: Krull Modules
abstract: In this article, we generalize the concepts of several classes of domains (which are related to Krull domains) to torsion-free modules, and show that for a faithful multiplication module M over an integral domain R, M is a Krull module if and only if R is a Krull domain. Then we characterize Krull, Dedekind, and factorial modules.

title: An inverse function theorem for free Lie algebras over commutative rings
Projective S-acts and Exact Functors
abstract: Let S be a semigroup. In this paper, projective S-acts and exact sequences in S-Act are studied. It is shown that, for a unitary S-act P, the functor Hom(P, ‚Äì) is exact if and only if P ‚âÖ Se for some idempotent e …õ S.

title: Simple Conformal Superalgebras of Finite Growth
abstract: In this paper, we construct six families of infinite simple conformal superalgebras of finite growth based on our earlier work on constructing vertex operator superalgebras from graded assocaitive algebras. Three subfamilies of these conformal superalgebras are generated by simple Jordan algebras of types A, B, and C in a certain sense.

title: A Singular Equation of Length Four Over Groups
abstract: Let G be a group and t an unknown. In this paper we prove that the equation atbtct‚àí1dt‚àí1 = 1 (a,b,c,d …õ G, a2 ‚â† 1, c2 ‚â† 1, bd ‚â† 1) has a solution over G. This forms part of a program to investigate precisely when an equation, whose associated star graph contains no admissible paths of length less than 3, fails to have a solution over G.

title: Centralizers of Iwahori-Hecke Algebras II: The General Case
abstract: This paper is a sequel to [4]. We establish the minimal basis theory for the centralizers of parabolic subalgebras of Iwahori-Hecke algebras associated to finite Coxeter groups of any type, generalizing the approach introduced in [3] from centres to the centralizer case. As a pro-requisite, we prove a reducibility property in the twisted J-conjugacy classes in finite Coxeter groups, which is a generalization of results in [7] and [4].

title: The Tor-Groups of Modules of Generalized Power Series
abstract: Let (S,‚â§) be a strictly ordered monoid, and R a right noetherian ring. Assume that M is a finitely generated right R-module and N a left R-module. Denote by [[M S,‚â§ ]] (resp., [[N S,‚â§ ]]) the right (resp., left) [[R S,‚â§ ]]-module of generalized power series over M (resp., over N). Then we show that there exists an isomorphism of abelian groups [Formula: see text].

title: Finite Non-abelian Simple Groups Which Contain a Non-trivial Semipermutable Subgroup
abstract: A subgroup H of a group G is called semipermutable if it is permutable with every subgroup K of G with (|H|,|K|)=1, and s-semipermutable if it is permutable with every Sylow p-subgroup of G with (p,|H|)=1. In this paper, we classify all finite non-abelian simple groups which contain a non-trivial semipermutable (s-semipermutable) subgroup. As a corollary of our main result, we give a complete answer to an unsolved problem in group theory proposed by V.S. Monakhov in 1990.

title: Links Between HX-Groups and Hypergroups
authors: Irina Cristea; Michal Nov√°k; Babatunde Oluwaseun Onasanya
abstract: The concept of an [Formula: see text]-group is an upgrade of the concept of a group, in which a new operation is defined on the family of non-empty subsets of a group. If this new support set together with the new operation is a group, then we call it an [Formula: see text]-group. On the other hand, a hyperoperation is a mapping having the same codomain as the operation of an [Formula: see text]-group, i.e., the family of non-empty subsets of the initial set, but a different domain ‚Äî the set itself. This could be (and was indeed) a source of confusion, which is clarified in this paper. Moreover, [Formula: see text]-groups naturally lead to constructions of hypergroups. The links between these two algebraic concepts are presented, with the aim of reviving the old notion of an [Formula: see text]-group in the current research on algebraic hyperstructures. One of such existing links and one newly established link are also discussed.

title: On t-Dimension of Polynomial Rings
abstract: In this paper, we study the t-dimension of a pullback and show that for any pair of integers (n,m) with 1 ‚â§ n ‚â§ m ‚â§ 2n-1, there is a domain R such that t- dim (R)=n and t- dim (R[X])=m.

title: Finite p-Groups of Class 3 All of Whose Proper Sections Have Class at Most 2
authors: Qiangwei Song; Haipeng Qu; Xiuyun Guo
abstract: In this paper, we give a characterization and a complete classification of minimal-class-3 p-groups, that is, the p-groups of class 3 all of whose proper sections have class at most 2.

title: The Ideal Structure of Semigroups of Linear Transformations with Lower Bounds on Their Nullity or Defect
abstract: Suppose V is an infinite-dimensional vector space and let T(V) denote the semigroup (under composition) of all linear transformations of V. In this paper, we study the semigroup OM(p,q) consisting of all Œ± ‚àà T(V) for which dim ker Œ± ‚â• q and the semigroup OE(p,q) of all Œ± ‚àà T(V) for which codim ran Œ± ‚â• q, where dim V = p ‚â• q ‚â• ‚Ñµ 0 . It is not difficult to see that OM(p,q) and OE(p,q) are a right ideal and a left ideal of T(V), respectively, and using these facts, we show that they belong to the class of all semigroups whose sets of bi-ideals and quasi-ideals coincide. Also, we describe Green's relations and the two-sided ideals of each semigroup, and determine its maximal regular subsemigroup. Finally, we determine some maximal right cancellative subsemigroups of OE(p,q).

title: Group Properties Characterized by Two-sided Configurations
abstract: In this paper, we define a new type of configurations as two-sided configurations, and investigate which group properties can be characterized by them. It is proved that for polycyclic torsion free groups, having the same finite quotient sets does not imply the (two-sided) configuration equivalence. We show that isomorphisms and configuration equivalences coincide for some free products of groups and a class of nilpotent groups.

title: Centralizer of Engel Elements in a Group
abstract: In this paper we show that some finiteness properties on a centralizer of a particular subgroup can be inherited by the whole group. Among other things, we prove the following characterization of polycyclic groups: a soluble group G is polycyclic if and only if it contains a finitely generated subgroup H, formed by bounded left Engel elements, whose centralizer C G (H) is polycyclic. In the context of ƒåernikov groups we obtain a more general result: a radical group is a ƒåernikov group if and only if it contains a finitely generated subgroup, formed by left Engel elements, whose centralizer is a ƒåernikov group. The aforementioned results generalize a theorem by Onishchuk and Zaƒ≠tsev about the centralizer of a finitely generated subgroup in a nilpotent group.

title: One-point Extensions and Recollements of Derived Categories
abstract: Let A be a finite dimensional algebra over an arbitrary field k. Assume that a bounded above derived category D - ( Mod A) admits a recollement relative to bounded above derived categories of two finite dimensional k-algebras B and C: [Formula: see text] In this paper, we prove that if there exist M ‚àà mod A and N ‚àà mod B such that i ‚ãÜ (N)=M, then the bounded above derived category D - ( Mod A[M]) admits a recollement relative to bounded above derived categories of two finite dimensional k-algebras B[N] and C: [Formula: see text] where A[M] and B[N] are the one-point extensions of A by M and of B by N, respectively. As a consequence, we obtain the main result of Barot and Lenzing [1].

title: On Some Generalized Identities with Derivations on Multilinear Polynomials
authors: Luisa Carini; Vincenzo De Filippis; Onofrio Mario Di Vincenzo
abstract: Let K be a commutative ring with unity, R a prime K-algebra of characteristic different from 2, Z(R) the center of R, f(x 1 ,‚Ä¶,x n ) a non-central multilinear polynomial over K, d and Œ¥ derivations of R, a and b fixed elements of R. Denote by f(R) the set of all evaluations of the polynomial f(x 1 ,‚Ä¶,x n ) in R. If a[d(u),u] + [Œ¥ (u),u]b = 0 for any u ‚àà f(R), we prove that one of the following holds: (i) d = Œ¥ = 0; (ii) d = 0 and b = 0; (iii) Œ¥ = 0 and a = 0; (iv) a, b ‚àà Z(R) and ad + bŒ¥ = 0. We also examine some consequences of this result related to generalized derivations and we prove that if d is a derivation of R and g a generalized derivation of R such that g([d(u),u]) = 0 for any u ‚àà f(R), then either g = 0 or d = 0.

title: Clusters in Non-simply-laced Finite Type via Frobenius Morphisms
abstract: By showing the compatibility of folding almost positive roots and folding cluster categories, we prove that there is a one-to-one correspondence between seeds and tilting seeds in non-simply-laced finite type.

title: Quantum Double for a Weak T-Coalgebra
abstract: In this paper, we mainly construct the quantum double D(H) of a weak T-coalgebra H and then prove that it is also a weak Hopf group coalgebra. Furthermore, we prove that the category of modules over D(H) is isomorphic to the category of weak Yetter‚ÄìDrinfeld group modules.

title: On Rings Whose Strongly Prime Ideals Are Completely Prime
authors: Chan Huh; Chang Ik Lee; Yang Lee
abstract: Kaplansky introduced the concept of the K-rings, concerning the commutativity of rings. In this paper, we concentrate on a property of K-rings, introducing the concept of the strongly NI rings, which is stronger than NI-ness. We first examine the relations among the concepts concerned with K-rings and strongly NI rings, constructing necessary examples in the process. We also show that strong NI-ness is a hereditary radical property.

title: Accessible subrings and Kurosh's chains of associative rings
abstract: Let N be a homomorphically closed class of associative rings. Put N1 = N 1 = N and for ordinals Œ± ‚â• 2, define NŒ±, (NŒ±) to be the class of all associative rings R such that every non-zero homomorphic image of R contains a non-zero ideal (left ideal) in NŒ≤ for some Œ≤ < Œ±. In this way we obtain a chain {NŒ±} ({NŒ±}), the union of which is equal to the lower radical class lN (lower left strong radical class lsN ) determined by N . The chain {NŒ±} is called Kurosh‚Äôs chain of N . In [11] Sulinski, Anderson and Divinsky studied the Kurosh‚Äôs chain in the universal class of associative rings. They described the classes NŒ± in terms of accessible subrings and proved that the chain stabilizes at the first limit ordinal œâ. They asked whether, for each ordinal Œ± ‚â§ œâ, there exists a class N such that lN = NŒ± 6= NŒ≤ for Œ≤ < Œ±. The question turned out to be very interesting and challenging. In [7], Heinicke answered it in the positive for Œ± = œâ. However, the problem for positive integers resisted effords of many authors for a long time. Various studies, except some general results, effected in solving the problem for small integers and determining when the chain stabilizes for some specific classes N . The general problem was finally solved in the positive by Beidar in [3]. After that, several new examples were found (see [1], [4], [9], [1! 0], [12]). All of them were not easy to handle and required quite complicated arguments. Developing some ideas of the mentioned papers (mainly those of [10]), we construct new general examples. The generality allows us to avoid particular calculations which, we hope, makes the arguments clearer and more visible. It also allows us to construct radicals which satisfy some extra properties. References. [1] R. R. Andruszkiewicz, E. R. Puczy lowski, Kurosh‚Äôs chains of associative rings, Glasgow Math. J. 32 (1990), 67‚Äì69. [2] E.R. Armendariz, W. G. Leavitt, The hereditary property in the lower radical construction, Canad. J. Math. 20 (1968), 474‚Äì476. [3] K. I. Beidar, A chain of Kurosh may have an arbitrary finite length, Czech. Math. J. 32 (1982), 418‚Äì422. [4] K. I Beidar, Semisimple classes and the lower radical, Mat. Issled. 105 (1988), 8‚Äì12 (in Russian). [5] N. Bourbaki, Algebre Commutative, Hermann, Paris, 1961‚Äì1965. [6] G. Ehrlich, Filial rings, Portugaliae. Math. 42 (1983/1984), 185‚Äì194. [7] A. Heinicke, A note on lower radical constructions for associative rings, Canad. Math. Bull. 11 (1968), 23‚Äì30. [8] A. G. Kurosh, Radicals of rings and algebras, Mat. Sbornik. 33 (1953), 13‚Äì26. [9] S. X. Liu, Y. L. Luo, A. P. Tang, J. Xiao, J. Y. Guo, Some results on modules and rings, Publ. Soc. Math. Belg. Ser, B, 39 (1987), 181‚Äì193.

title: On Finite Presentability of Direct Products of Semigroups
abstract: A finite semigroup S is said to preserve finite generation (resp., presentability) in direct products, provided that, for every infinite semigroup T, the direct product S √ó T is finitely generated (resp., finitely presented) if and only if T is finitely generated (resp., finitely presented). The main result of this paper is a constructive necessary and sufficient condition for S to preserve both finite generation and presentability in direct products. The condition is that certain graphs, (s), one for each s …õ S, are all connected. The main result is illustrated in three examples, one of which exhibits a 4-element semigroup that preserves finite generation but not finite presentability in direct products.

title: Morita‚ÄìTakeuchi Contexts Acting on Graded Coalgebras
abstract: In this paper, we introduce the concept of graded Morita‚ÄìTakeuchi contexts and prove that every graded Morita‚ÄìTakeuchi context induces a Morita‚ÄìTakeuchi context between the 1-components of the corresponding coalgebras. We also establish an action of Morita‚ÄìTakeuchi contexts on graded coalgebras, which is important for the development of the action of Picard groups on graded coalgebras.

title: Auslander‚ÄìReiten Orbit Algebras for Self-Injective Nakayama Algebras
abstract: The main result of this paper is the following: Let A be a self-injective Nakayama K-algebra, which is basic and connected. Suppose that A is a right A e -module of œÑ A e -period 1. (1) If A is an algebra whose Jacobson radical square is zero, then [Formula: see text]. (2) If A is an algebra whose Jacobson radical square is not zero, then [Formula: see text] for some positive integer n.

title: Injective Endomorphisms of the Baumslag‚ÄìSolitar Group
abstract: We study the injective endomorphisms œÜ of the Baumslag‚ÄìSolitar group G(n,m)= „Äàa,t | t -1 a n t=a m „Äâ for n, m ‚àà ‚Ñ§‚àñ{0} such that n, m ‚â† ¬± 1, and show that œÜ (a) ‚àà ‚à™ i ‚àà ‚Ñ§‚àñ{0} (a i ) G . The proof is based on the Bass‚ÄìSerre theory of graphs of groups.

title: Witt Rings and Permutation Polynomials
abstract: Let p be a prime number. In this paper, the author sets up a canonical correspondence between polynomial functions over ‚Ñ§/p 2 ‚Ñ§ and 3-tuples of polynomial functions over ‚Ñ§/p‚Ñ§. Based on this correspondence, he proves and reproves some fundamental results on permutation polynomials mod p l . The main new result is the characterization of strong orthogonal systems over ‚Ñ§/p l ‚Ñ§.

title: On the Tubes of Exterior Algebras
authors: Jin-Yun Guo; Qiuxian Wu; Qianhong Wan
abstract: In this paper, we study the Koszul modules of complexity 1 of an exterior algebra of a vector space V over an algebraically closed field. We prove that there are ‚Ñô (V)-orthogonal families of such modules, each of which consists of Koszul modules filtered by the cyclic ones corresponding to the same point in ‚Ñô (V). We also prove that they are invariant under syzygy, so they are all on the homogeneous tubes.

title: On the Structure of a Class of Graded Modules Related to Symmetric Pairs
abstract: Let [Formula: see text] be the Cartan decomposition of a real semisimple Lie algebra and [Formula: see text] be its complexification. Let [Formula: see text] be the corresponding isotropy representation, and the exterior algebra [Formula: see text] becomes a graded [Formula: see text]-module by extending ŒΩ. We study a graded [Formula: see text]-submodule C of [Formula: see text] and get two important decompositions of the [Formula: see text]-module [Formula: see text]. Let [Formula: see text] be the symmetric algebra over [Formula: see text]. Then [Formula: see text] also has an [Formula: see text]-module structure, which is [Formula: see text]-equivariant, and C is a space of generators for this module. Our results generalize Kostant's results in the special case that ŒΩ is the adjoint representation of a semisimple Lie algebra.

title: The Order of Hypersubstitutions of Type œÑ = (3)
abstract: Hypersubstitutions were introduced in [3] as a way of making precise the concepts of hyperidentity and M-hyperidentity. The monoid of hypersubstitutions has been widely studied by many authors. Knowledge of the monoid of hypersubstitutions can be applied to the concept of M-hyperidentities. In this paper, we show that the order of hypersubstitutions of type œÑ = (3) is 1, 2, 3 or infinite.

title: Degree Stable Lie Algebras I
abstract: We define a degree stable Lie algebra. Since the special type Lie algebra S + (2) is degree stable, we find the automorphism group Aut Lie (S + (2)) of the Lie algebra S + (2) and prove the Jacobian conjecture of the Lie algebra S + (2).

title: A Note on the œÉ-Covers of Finite Soluble Groups
abstract: A cover for a finite group is a set of proper subgroups whose union is the whole group. For a finite group G, we denote by œÉ (G) the least positive integer n such that G has a cover of size n. This paper deals with the covers of a finite soluble group G having œÉ (G) elements of maximal subgroups.

title: Dual Quasi-Hopf Algebras and Antipodes
abstract: Let H be a coalgebra. In this paper, we show that H is a dual quasi-bialgebra if and only if the category [Formula: see text] of comodules is a tensor category; and H is a braided dual quasi-bialgebra if and only if [Formula: see text] is a braided tensor category. If H is a braided dual quasi-Hopf algebra, it is shown that the antipode of H is inner, i.e., s 2 (h) = ‚àë œÑ (h 1 )h 2 œÑ -1 (h 3 ).

title: n-Clean Rings
abstract: Let n be a positive integer. A ring R is called n-clean if every element of R can be written as a sum of an idempotent and n units in R. The class of n-clean rings contains clean rings and (S,n)-rings (i.e., every element is a sum of no more than n units). In this paper, we investigate some properties on n-clean rings. There exists a clean and (S,3)-ring which is not an (S,2)-ring. If R is a ring satisfying (SI), then the polynomial ring R[x] is not n-clean for any positive integer n. An example shows that for any positive integer n> 1, there exists a non n-clean ring R such that the 2√ó 2 matrix ring M 2 (R) over R is n-clean.

title: The Lie Pseudoalgebra of an Anchored Module
abstract: The aim of this paper is to define and to construct some ‚àû-Lie functors from two categories of anchored modules which admit linear connections to the corresponding categories of Lie pseudoalgebras; the isomorphism class of the Lie pseudoalgebra does not depend on the linear connection or on the corresponding bracket. In the particular case of a module, the ‚àû-Lie algebra is isomorphic with the free Lie algebra of the module in Bourbaki's sense.

title: Introduction to Noether‚Äôs problem for dihedral groups. Proceedings of the International Conference on Algebra
A Characterization of P-Compatible Varieties
authors: Ivan Chajda; Klaus Denecke; Shelly L. Wismath
abstract: P-Compatibility is a hereditary property of identities which generalizes the properties of normality and externality of identities. Chajda characterized the normalization of a variety by an algebraic construction called a choice algebra. In this paper, we generalize this characterization to the least P-compatible variety P(V) determined by a variety V for any partition P using P-choice algebras. We also study the clone of (strongly) P-compatible n-ary terms of a variety V, and relate identities of this clone to (strongly) P-compatible hyperidentities of the variety V.

title: The General PBW Property
abstract: For ungraded quotients of an arbitrary ‚Ñ§-graded ring, we define the general PBW property, that covers the classical PBW property and the N-type PBW property studied via the N-Koszulity by several authors (see [2‚Äì4]). In view of the noncommutative Gr√∂bner basis theory, we conclude that every ungraded quotient of a path algebra (or a free algebra) has the general PBW property. We remark that an earlier result of Golod [5] concerning Gr√∂bner bases can be used to give a homological characterization of the general PBW property in terms of Shafarevich complex. Examples of application are given.

title: Characterizations of Disconnected Matroids
abstract: Three necessary and sufficient conditions for a matroid in the sense of Betten and Wenzel to be disconnected are given in this paper.

title: Some Rigidity Results for Highest Order Local Cohomology Modules
abstract: Let R be a commutative Noetherian ring, ùîû an ideal of R, and M a finitely generated R-module of finite Krull dimension n. We describe the (finite) sets [Formula: see text] and [Formula: see text] of primes associated and attached to the highest local cohomology module [Formula: see text] in terms of the local formal behaviour of ùîû.

title: Notes on More Fibonacci Groups
abstract: The Fibonacci manifolds M n introduced by Helling, Kim and Mennicke are generalized in an obvious way suggested by a tessellation of triangles on the boundary of 3-balls. We construct an infinite family of hyperbolic 3-manifolds by a tessellation of (2‚Ñì +1)-gons on the boundary of a combinatorial polyhedron P(2‚Ñì +1, n). We prove that these manifolds are the n-fold cyclic branched coverings of S 3 over the 2-bridge knot b(4‚Ñì 2 +1, 2‚Ñì), and investigate some topological and geometrical properties of the manifolds together with their first homology groups and split extensions.

title: The Influence of Certain Abelian Subgroups on the Structure of Finite Groups
abstract: Let G be a finite group. A subgroup K of a group G is called an [Formula: see text]-subgroup of G if N G (K) ‚à© K x ‚â§ K for all x ‚àà G. The set of all [Formula: see text]-subgroups of G is denoted by [Formula: see text]. In this paper, we investigate the structure of a group G under the assumption that certain abelian subgroups of prime power order belong to [Formula: see text].

title: Non-commutative Poisson Algebra Structures on the Lie Algebra $so_n\widetilde{({\Bbb C}_Q)}$
abstract: Non-commutative Poisson algebras are the algebras having both an associative algebra structure and a Lie algebra structure together with the Leibniz law. In this paper, the non-commutative poisson algebra structures on [Formula: see text] are determined.

title: S-‚àów-Principal Ideal Domains
abstract: Let D be an integral domain, ‚àó a star-operation on D, and S a multiplicative subset of D. We define D to be an S-‚àó w -principal ideal domain if for each nonzero ideal I of D, there exist an element s ‚àà S and a principal ideal (c) of D such that [Formula: see text]. In this paper, we study some properties of S-‚àó w -principal ideal domains. Among other things, we study the local property, the Nagata type theorem, and the Cohen type theorem for S-‚àó w -principal ideal domains.

title: On Boolean Lattices of Module Classes
authors: Alejandro Alvarado-Garc√≠a; C√©sar Cejudo-Castilla; Hugo Alberto Rinc√≥n-Mej√≠a; Ivan Fernando Vilchis-Montalvo; Manuel Gerardo Zorrilla-Noriega
abstract: Some properties of and relations between several (big) lattices of module classes are used in this paper to obtain information about the ring over which modules are taken. The authors reach characterizations of trivial rings, semisimple rings and certain rings over which every torsion theory is hereditary.

title: Automorphism Groups of Bouwer Graphs
abstract: Let k, m and n be three positive integers such that 2 m ‚â° 1 (mod n) and k ‚â• 2. The Bouwer graph, which is denoted by B(k, m, n), is the graph with vertex set [Formula: see text] and two vertices being adjacent if they can be written as (a, b) and (a + 1, c), where either c = b or [Formula: see text] differs from [Formula: see text] in exactly one position, say the jth position, where [Formula: see text]. Every B(k, m, n) is a vertex- and edge-transitive graph, and Bouwer proved that B(k, 6, 9) is half-arc-transitive for every k ‚â• 2. In 2016, Conder and ≈Ωitnik gave the classification of half-arc-transitive Bouwer graphs. In this paper, the full automorphism group of every B(k, m, n) is determined.

title: Lie Triple Derivations of the Lie Algebra of Dominant Block Upper Triangular Matrices
abstract: Let [Formula: see text] be the Lie algebra of all n√ón dominant block upper triangular matrices over a field ùîΩ. In this paper, we explicitly describe all Lie triple derivations of [Formula: see text] when char(ùîΩ) ‚â† 2. As an application, we characterize Lie derivations of [Formula: see text] when char(ùîΩ) ‚â† 2.

title: Differential Inverse Power Series Rings with Quasi-Armendariz-like Condition
abstract: A generalization of semiprime rings and right p.q.-Baer rings, which we call quasi-Armendariz rings of differential inverse power series type (or simply, [Formula: see text]-quasi-Armendariz), is introduced and studied. It is shown that the [Formula: see text]-quasi-Armendariz rings are closed under direct sums, upper triangular matrix rings, full matrix rings and Morita invariance. Various classes of non-semiprime [Formula: see text]-quasi-Armendariz rings are provided, and a number of properties of this generalization are established. Some characterizations for the differential inverse power series ring [Formula: see text] to be quasi-Baer, generalized quasi-Baer, primary, nilary, reflexive, ideal-symmetric and left AIP are concluded, where Œ¥ is a derivation on the ring R. Finally, miscellaneous examples to illustrate and delimit the theory are given.

title: Excellent Extensions and Homological Conjectures
abstract: In this paper, we introduce the notion of excellent extensions of rings. Let Œì be an excellent extension of an Artin algebra Œõ, we prove that Œõ satisfies the Gorenstein symmetry conjecture (resp., finitistic dimension conjecture, Auslander‚ÄìGorenstein conjecture, Nakayama conjecture) if and only if so does Œì. As a special case of excellent extensions, when G is a finite group whose order is invertible in Œõ acting on Œõ and Œõ is G-stable, we prove that if the skew group algebra ŒõG satisfies strong Nakayama conjecture (resp., generalized Nakayama conjecture), then so does Œõ.

title: Two Kinds of Infinite-Dimensional Novikov Algebras and Their Sub-adjacent Lie Algebras
authors: Xin Zhou; Liangyun Chen; Bing Sun
abstract: In this paper, we construct two kinds of infinite-dimensional Novikov algebras and give their realizations, respectively. As an application, we describe their sub-adjacent Lie algebras and characterize some of their properties.

title: Hermitian Adjacency Spectrum of Cayley Digraphs over Dihedral Group
abstract: We first study the spectrum of Hermitian adjacency matrix (H-spectrum) of Cayley digraphs X(D 2n , S) on dihedral group D 2n with |S| = 3. Then we show that all Cayley digraphs X(D 2p , S) with |S| = 3 and p odd prime are Cay-DS, namely, for any Cayley digraph X(D 2p , T), X(D 2p , T) and X(D 2p , S) having the same H-spectrum implies that they are isomorphic.

title: On f-Disjunctive Languages, f-Disjunctive Domains and Solid Codes
authors: Jing Leng; Yuqi Guo; K. P. Shum
abstract: Every language is either the disjoint union or the intersection of two disjunctive languages. The family of f-disjunctive languages is a natural generalization of the family of disjunctive languages. Disjunctive domains (f-disjunctive domains) are defined as the languages which can be checked whether a given language is disjunctive (f-disjunctive) or not. The f-disjunctive domains were first studied by Guo et al. around 1986‚Äì1989. We continue their study on f-disjunctive domains. Some new results for f-disjunctive domains, containing a relation between disjunctive domains and f-disjunctive domains, are introduced. In this respect, we also make an appropriate opening for the completely dense languages and solid codes.

title: Braided Extensions of a Pointed Fusion Category with Prime Dimension
abstract: We obtain a necessary condition for a strictly weakly integral generalized Tambara‚ÄìYamagami fusion category to be braided. Then we use this result to classify braided extensions of a pointed fusion category with prime dimension.

title: Gauge Inverse Monoids
abstract: The paper introduces a class of inverse (sub)monoids which contains Jones‚ÄìLawson‚Äôs gauge inverse (sub)monoid. The aim is to give examples and the basic properties of these monoids. Jones‚ÄìLawson‚Äôs gauge inverse monoid, as an inverse submonoid of the polycyclic monoid, is the prototype in our development line. The generalization leads also to Meakin‚ÄìSapir type results involving bijections between special congruences and special wide inverse submonoids.

title: A Note on z-Ideals and z¬∞-Ideals of the Formal Power Series Rings and Polynomial Rings in an Infinite Set of Indeterminates
abstract: Let A be a ring. In this paper we generalize some results introduced by Aliabad and Mohamadian. We give a relation between the z-ideals of A and those of the formal power series rings in an infinite set of indeterminates over A. Consider A[[X Œõ ]] 3 and its subrings A[[X Œõ ]] 1 , A[[X Œõ ]] 2 , and A[[X Œõ ]] Œ± , where Œ± is an infinite cardinal number. In fact, a z-ideal of the rings defined above is of the form I + (X Œõ ) i , where i = 1, 2, 3 or an infinite cardinal number and I is a z-ideal of A. In addition, we prove that the same condition given by Aliabad and Mohamadian can be used to get a relation between the minimal prime ideals of the ring of the formal power series in an infinite set of indeterminates and those of the ring of coefficients. As a natural result, we get a relation between the z¬∞-ideals of the formal power series ring in an infinite set of indeterminates and those of the ring of coefficients.

title: Completed Tensor Product and Flatness
abstract: We give, in a more general case than the Noetherian case, an answer to the question posed by Shaul on the flatness of the completed tensor product.

title: Remarks on Gorenstein Weak Injective and Weak Flat Modules
abstract: In this paper, we introduce Gorenstein weak injective and weak flat modules in terms of, respectively, weak injective and weak flat modules; the classes of Gorenstein weak injective and weak flat modules are larger than the classical classes of Gorenstein injective and flat modules. In this new setting, we characterize rings over which all modules are Gorenstein weak injective. Moreover, we discuss the relation between the weak cosyzygy and Gorenstein weak cosyzygy of a module, and also the stability of Gorenstein weak injective modules.

title: Jordan Derivations of Special Subrings of Matrix Rings
abstract: Let K be a 2-torsion free ring with identity and R n (K, J) be the ring of all n √ó n matrices over K such that the entries on and above the main diagonal are elements of an ideal J of K. We describe all Jordan derivations of the matrix ring R n (K, J) in this paper. The main result states that every Jordan derivation Œî of R n (K, J) is of the form Œî = D + Œ©, where D is a derivation of R n (K, J) and Œ© is an extremal Jordan derivation of R n (K, J).

title: Skew-symmetric Elements in Nonlinear Involutions in Group Rings
abstract: Given an involution in a group G, it can be extended in various ways to an involution in the group ring RG, where R is a ring, not necessarily commutative. In this paper nonlinear extensions are considered and necessary and sufficient conditions are given on the group G, its involution, the ring R and the extension for the set of skew-symmetric elements to be commutative and for it to be anticommutative.

title: Co-Cohen-Macaulay Modules and Generalized Local Cohomology
abstract: Let (R,ùî™) be a Noetherian local ring, ùîû a proper ideal of R, and M, N two finitely generated R-modules of finite projective dimension m and of finite dimension n, respectively. It is shown that if n ‚â§ 2, then the generalized local cohomology module [Formula: see text] is a co-Cohen-Macaulay module. Additionally, we show that [Formula: see text] for all i > m+s and [Formula: see text], where s is the cohomological dimension of N with respect to ùîû.

title: Universal Enveloping Algebras of Simple Symplectic Anti-Jordan Triple Systems
abstract: In this work we are concerned with the universal associative envelope of a finite-dimensional simple symplectic anti-Jordan triple system (AJTS). We prove that if ùïã is a triple system as above, then there exists an associative algebra U(ùïã) and an injective homomorphism Œµ : ùïã ‚Üí U(ùïã), where U(ùïã) is an AJTS under the triple product defined by (a,b,c) = abc - cba. Moreover, U(ùïã) is a universal object with respect to such homomorphisms. We explicitly determine the PBW-basis of U(ùïã), the center Z(U(ùïã)) and the Gelfand-Kirillov dimension of U(ùïã).

title: A Note on Comultiplication Modules
abstract: Let R be a commutative ring with identity. An R-module M is said to be a comultiplication module if for every submodule N of M, there exists an ideal I of R such that N=(0: M I). In this paper, we show: (1) If M is a comultiplication module and N is a copure submodule of M, then M/N is a comultiplication module. (2) If M is a comultiplication module satisfying the DAC and N ‚â§ M, then N ‚â§ e M if and only if there exists I ‚â™ R such that N=(0: M I). (3) If M is a comultiplication module satisfying the DAC, then M is finitely cogenerated. Finally, we give a partial answer to a question posed by Ansari-Toroghy and Farshadifar.

title: The q-Analog Klein Bottle Lie Algebra
authors: Cuipo Jiang; Jingjing Jiang; Yufeng Pei
abstract: In this paper, we study an infinite-dimensional Lie algebra ‚Ñ¨ q , called the q-analog Klein bottle Lie algebra. We show that ‚Ñ¨ q is a finitely generated simple Lie algebra with a unique (up to scalars) symmetric invariant bilinear form. The derivation algebra and the universal central extension of ‚Ñ¨ q are also determined.

title: Attached Primes of Local Cohomology for Modules Finite over a Ring Homomorphism
authors: Abolfazl Tehranian; Massoud Tousi; Siamak Yassemi
abstract: Let ùúë : R ‚Üí S be a ring homomorphism of Noetherian rings and let ùîû be an ideal of R. Let M be a finitely generated S-module with dim R (M)=d. In this paper, we prove that the R-module [Formula: see text] has a secondary representation and we exhibit its set of attached primes (under some technical conditions).

title: Groups with Finiteness Conditions on the Lower Central Series of Subgroups
abstract: Let k be a positive integer. Locally graded groups G for which one of the sets {Œ≥ k (H)| H ‚â§ G} and {Œ≥ k (H)| H ‚â§G, H infinite } is finite are classified.

title: On Block-transitive 6-(v, k, Œª)-Designs with k at Most 10000
authors: Tan Qiong-hua; Weijun Liu; Jing Chen
abstract: In recent years, there has been a great deal of research concerning the flag-transitive t-designs, however, few about the block-transitive t-designs with t large (t ‚â• 4). In 1993, Cameron and Praeger conjectured that there are no non-trivial block-transitive 6-designs. In this paper, we prove that the conjecture is true when k ‚â§ 10000 and [Formula: see text] is almost simple.

title: The œÉ-Derivations of ‚ÑÇ[x<sup>¬±1</sup>,y<sup>¬±1</sup>]
authors: Guang‚Äôai Song; Yuezhu Wu; B. Xin
abstract: In the present paper, the œÉ-derivations of ‚ÑÇ[x ¬±1 ,y ¬±1 ] are determined, and their applications are considered.

title: Finite Groups Whose Character Degree Graphs Are Empty Graphs
abstract: In this paper, we classify and determine the structure of finite groups whose character degree graphs are empty graphs.

title: The k-Nacci Sequences in Some Special Modular Groups
abstract: A k-nacci (k-step Fibonacci) sequence in a finite group is a sequence of group elements x 0 , x 1 , x 2 , ‚Ä¶, x n , ‚Ä¶ for which, given an initial (seed) set x 0 , x 1 , x 2 , ‚Ä¶, x j-1 , each element is defined by [Formula: see text] From the definition, it is clear that the period of the k-nacci sequence in a group depends on the chosen generating set and the order in which the assignments of x 0 , x 1 , x 2 , ‚Ä¶, x j-1 are made. In this paper we examine the periods of the k-nacci sequences in the groups ùîê 2 , [Formula: see text] and ‚Ñú 2 , where each term of the sequence is reduced modulo 2.

title: Finite Groups with ‚Ñã-Subgroups
abstract: Let [Formula: see text] be a saturated formation containing [Formula: see text], and G be a finite group. Li etc. proposed a problem: whether there is a normality such that the following two statements are equivalent: (i) [Formula: see text]. (ii) There exists a normal subgroup H of G such that [Formula: see text] and for each Sylow subgroup P of F*(H), every member in some [Formula: see text] satisfies the above normality in G. In this paper, we find a normality satisfying the above problem. Moreover, by using the concept of ‚Ñã-subgroups, we obtain other results about the influence of the members of some fixed [Formula: see text] on the structure of G.

title: Extension Data and Their Lie Algebras
abstract: We state the notion of an extension datum of a root system. This concept generalizes the root system extended by an abelian group. We classify them, and show that there is a one-to-one correspondence between (reduced) root systems extended by an abelian group and (reduced) tame irreducible extension data. We also show that an extension datum, modulo some isotropic roots, is the union of a finite number of tame irreducible extension data.

title: On the Strong Nilpotence Problem
abstract: In this paper, we describe the structure of quadratic homogeneous polynomial maps F=X+H with JH 3 =0. As a consequence we show that in dimension n ‚â§ 6, JH is strongly nilpotent, or equivalently F=X+H is linearly triangularizable.

title: On Standard Invariants of Bi-polymatroidal Ideals
abstract: The standard invariants of the bi-polymatroidal ideals of Veronese type are computed.

title: An Abstract Construction of Vertex Algebras
abstract: In this paper, we introduce an abstract method of constructing vertex algebras which satisfy the C 1 -cofiniteness condition. We give some examples to explain how to use this abstract method.

title: Œ©-Gorenstein Projective, Injective and Flat Modules
abstract: In this paper, we study some properties of Œ©-Gorenstein projective, injective and flat modules and discuss some connections between Œ©-Gorenstein injective and Œ©-Gorenstein flat modules. We also consider these properties under change of rings.

title: Geometry of Alternate Matrices over Bezout Domains
authors: Liping Huang; Ying-Chun Li; Kang Zhao
abstract: Let R be a commutative Bezout domain. Denote by [Formula: see text] the set of all n √ó n alternate matrices over R. This paper discusses the adjacency preserving bijective maps in both directions on [Formula: see text], and extends Liu's theorem on the geometry of alternate matrices over a field to the case of a Bezout domain.

title: The Weakly Potency of Certain HNN Extensions of Nilpotent Groups
authors: Kok Bin Wong; P. C. Wong
abstract: In this paper we give a characterization for certain HNN extensions of subgroup separable groups with normal associated subgroups to be weakly potent. We then apply our result to show that certain HNN extensions of finitely generated nilpotent groups with central associated subgroups are weakly potent.

title: Milnor-Witt K-Theory and Tensor Powers of the Augmentation Ideal of ‚Ñ§[F<sup>√ó</sup>]
abstract: Let F be a field of characteristic not equal to 2. We describe the relation between the non-negative dimensional Milnor-Witt K-theory of F and the tensor algebra over the group ring ‚Ñ§[F √ó ] of the augmentation ideal [Formula: see text]. In the process, we clarify the structure of the additive group [Formula: see text], giving a simple presentation in particular.

title: Distributive Lattices of M-Rectangular Divided-semirings
abstract: In this paper, we first introduce the so-called M-rectangular divided-semirings and distributive lattices of M-rectangular divided-semirings. We then discuss the relations between such a semiring and its multiplicative semigroup. Finally, we investigate subdirect product decompositions of these semirings and obtain some interesting results.

title: Finite Groups in Which Class Preserving and Central Automorphisms Coincide
abstract: A necessary and sufficient condition for the equality of class preserving and central automorphisms of a finite group is given.

title: On Certain Functional Equation in Semiprime Rings
abstract: Let n be a fixed integer, let R be an (n+1)!-torsion free semiprime ring with the identity element and let F: R ‚Üí R be an additive mapping satisfying the relation [Formula: see text] for all x ‚àà R. In this case, we prove that F is of the form 2F(x)=D(x)+ax+xa for all x ‚àà R, where D: R ‚Üí R is a derivation and a ‚àà R is some fixed element.

title: Finite Groups of Spencer Height ‚â§ 3
authors: Wenbin Guo; Dina P. Andreeva; Alexander N. Skiba
abstract: In this paper, we describe the finite groups G in which every maximal chain M 3 < M 2 < M 1 < M 0 =G contains a proper subnormal subgroup of G.

title: Minimal Non-nilpotent and Locally Nilpotent Fusion Systems
abstract: The main purpose of this note is to show that there is a one-to-one correspondence between minimal non-nilpotent (resp., locally nilpotent) saturated fusion systems and finite p‚Ä≤-core-free p-constrained minimal non-nilpotent (resp., locally p-nilpotent) groups.

title: On the Unions of Ascending Chains of Direct Sums of Ideals of h-Local Pr√ºfer Domains
abstract: In this work, we investigate conditions under which unions of ascending chains of modules which are isomorphic to direct sums of ideals of an integral domain are again isomorphic to direct sums of ideals. We obtain generalizations of the Pontryagin-Hill theorems for modules which are direct sums of ideals of h-local Pr√ºfer domains. Particularly, we prove that a torsion-free module over a Dedekind domain with a countable number of maximal ideals is isomorphic to a direct sum of ideals if it is the union of a countable ascending chain of pure submodules which are isomorphic to direct sums of ideals.

title: Noether's Problem for p-Groups with an Abelian Subgroup of Index p
abstract: Let K be a field and G be a finite group. Let G act on the rational function field K(x(g) : g ‚àà G) by K-automorphisms defined by g ¬∑ x(h) = x(gh) for any g, h ‚àà G. Denote by K(G) the fixed field K(x(g) : g ‚àà G) G . Noether's problem then asks whether K(G) is rational over K. Let p be an odd prime and let G be a p-group of exponent p e . Assume also that (i) char K = p > 0, or (ii) char K ‚â† p and K contains a primitive p e -th root of unity. In this paper we prove that K(G) is rational over K for the following two types of groups: (1) G is a finite p-group with an abelian normal subgroup H of index p such that H is a direct product of normal subgroups of G of the type C p b √ó (C p ) c for some b, c with 1 ‚â§ b and 0 ‚â§ c; (2) G is any group of order p 5 from the isoclinic families with numbers 1, 2, 3, 4, 8 and 9.

title: Cohen-Macaulay and Gorenstein Path Ideals of Trees
abstract: Let R=k[x 1 ,‚Ä¶,x n ], where k is a field. The path ideal (of length t ‚â• 2) of a directed graph G is the monomial ideal, denoted by I t (G), whose generators correspond to the directed paths of length t in G. Let Œì be a directed rooted tree. We characterize all such trees whose path ideals are unmixed and Cohen-Macaulay. Moreover, we show that R/I t (Œì) is Gorenstein if and only if the Stanley-Reisner simplicial complex of I t (Œì) is a matroid.

title: t-Singular Linear Spaces
authors: Jun Guo; Fenggao Li; Kaishun Wang
abstract: As a generalization of singular linear spaces, we introduce the concept of t-singular linear spaces, make some anzahl formulas of subspaces, and determine the suborbits of t-singular linear groups.

title: A Schreier Domain Type Condition II
authors: Zaheer Ahmad; Tiberiu Dumitrescu; Mihai Epure
abstract: Let D be an integral domain and ‚àó a star operation on D. We study the domains characterized by the following property: whenever I ‚äá AB with I, A, B nonzero ideals, there exist nonzero ideals H and J such that I ‚àó = (HJ) ‚àó , H ‚àó ‚äá A and J ‚àó ‚äá B. We call them ‚àó-sharp domains. We show that D is t-sharp if and only if D[X] is t-sharp if and only if D[X] N v is d-sharp, where N v is the multiplicative set of D[X] consisting of all nonzero polynomials a 0 + a 1 X + ‚ãØ + a n X n such that (a 0 ,a 1 ,‚Ä¶,a n ) v = D.

title: Generators of Simple Modular Lie Superalgebras
abstract: Let $X$ be one of the finite-dimensional simple graded Lie superalgebras of Cartan type $W, S, H, K, HO, KO, SHO$ or $SKO$ over an algebraically closed field of characteristic $p>3$. In this paper we prove that $X$ can be generated by one element except the ones of type $W,$ $HO$, $KO$ or $SKO$ in certain exceptional cases, in which $X$ can be generated by two elements. As a subsidiary result, we also prove that certain classical Lie superalgebras or their relatives can be generated by one or two elements.

title: Extended Varshamov-Gilbert-Sacks Bound for Linear Lee Weight Codes
abstract: The Lee weight is more appropriate for some practical situations than the Hamming weight as it takes into account of the magnitude of each digit of the word. In this paper, we obtain a sufficient condition over the number of parity check digits for codes correcting simultaneously random and burst errors with Lee weight consideration. This sufficient condition is an extension of the Varshamov-Gilbert-Sacks bound for codes correcting simultaneously random and burst errors with Lee weight constraint.

title: Derivations and Automorphism Group of Completed Witt Lie Algebra
authors: Yongping Wu; Ying Xu; Lamei Yuan
abstract: In this paper, a simple Lie algebra, referred to as the completed Witt Lie algebra, is introduced. Its derivation algebra and automorphism group are completely described. As a by-product, it is obtained that the first cohomology group of this Lie algebra with coefficients in its adjoint module is trivial. Furthermore, we completely determine the conjugate classes of this Lie algebra under its automorphism group, and also obtain that this Lie algebra does not contain any nonzero ad -locally finite element.

title: S<sub>n</sub>-Normal Semigroups of Partial Transformations
authors: Sean V. Droms; Janusz Konieczny; Roberto Palomba
abstract: For an integer n ‚â• 1, let [Formula: see text] and S n be, respectively, the semigroup of partial transformations and the symmetric group on the set X = {1,‚Ä¶,n}. Then S n is the group of units of [Formula: see text]. A subsemigroup S of [Formula: see text] is S n -normal if for all a ‚àà S and g ‚àà S n , g -1 ag ‚àà S. In 1976, Symons described the S n -normal semigroups of full transformations of X. In 1995, Lipscomb and the second author determined the S n -normal semigroups of partial injective transformations of X. In this paper, we complete the classification by describing all S n -normal subsemigroups of [Formula: see text]. As a consequence of the classification theorem, we obtain a characterization of the automorphisms of any S n -normal subsemigroup of [Formula: see text].

title: Array Codes in the Generalized Lee-RT Pseudo-Metric (GLRTP-Metric)
abstract: In this paper, we introduce a pseudo-metric on the space of all m √ó s matrices with entries from the finite ring Z q , generalizing the classical Lee metric and the array RT metric, and name this pseudo-metric as the generalized Lee-RT pseudo-metric (or the GLRTP-metric). We also obtain some bounds on the parameters of array codes equipped with the GLRTP-metric.

title: Complexes of FP-injective Modules
abstract: In this paper, we study the class [Formula: see text] of complexes of FP-injective left R-modules. It is shown that the pair [Formula: see text] is a complete cotorsion pair. If R is a left coherent ring, it is proved that every complex has an [Formula: see text]-cover. We also introduce the FP-injective dimension of complexes. A special attention is paid to the dimension of homologically bounded above R-complexes over a left coherent ring which has a nice functorial description.

title: Direct Sums of Hollow-lifting Modules
abstract: A module M over a ring R is called hollow-lifting if every submodule N of M with M/N hollow contains a direct summand K of M such that N/K is a small submodule of M/K. It is known that a (finite) direct sum of hollow-lifting modules need not be hollow-lifting. In this paper, we show that a quotient of a hollow-lifting module is not hollow-lifting in general, and discuss when a direct sum of hollow-lifting modules is hollow-lifting. We also study relative properties of hollow-lifting modules and investigate direct sums of X-hollow-lifting modules.

title: Embedding Regular Semigroups into Idempotent Generated Ones
abstract: Any semigroup S can be embedded into a semigroup, denoted by Œ®S, having some remarkable properties. For general semigroups there is a close relationship between local submonoids of S and of Œ®S. For a number of usual semigroup properties [Formula: see text], we prove that S and Œ®S simultaneously satisfy [Formula: see text] or not. For a regular semigroup S, the relationship of S and Œ®S is even closer, especially regarding the natural partial order and Green's relations; in addition, every element of Œ®S is a product of at most four idempotents. For completely regular semigroups S, the relationship of S and Œ®S is still closer. On the lattice [Formula: see text] of varieties of completely regular semigroups [Formula: see text] regarded as algebras with multiplication and inversion, by means of Œ®S, we define an operator, denoted by Œ®. We compare Œ® with some of the standard operators on [Formula: see text] and evaluate it on a small sublattice of [Formula: see text].

title: The Pairs of Finite p-Groups
authors: Mohammad Reza R. Moghaddam; Ali Reza Salemkar; Seyed Mohammad Davarpanah
abstract: Let M be a normal subgroup of a finite group G such that |G/M| = p m and |M/Z(M,G)| = p n . In this paper, we characterize all the pairs of groups (M,G) which satisfy the conditions [Formula: see text] and |[M/Z(M,G),G/Z(M,G)]|‚â§ p. If M has a complement in G and |M|=p n and |G/M|=p m , then there always exists a non-negative integer t(M,G) such that [Formula: see text]. Under some conditions, we determine all the pairs (M,G) with t(M,G)=0, 1 or 2.

title: A Note on the p-Deficiency Class of a Finite Group
authors: Tianze Li; Weigang Xu; Jiping Zhang
abstract: In this note, we explore the relationship between finite groups of characteristic p type and those of p-deficiency class 1. We study the structure of finite groups of characteristic p type. Besides, we show that the p-rank (resp., p-length) of a p-solvable group which is of exact p-deficiency class r(> 0) is bounded by r (resp., a function of r).

title: The c-Normal Embedding Property in Finite Groups (I)
authors: Huaquan Wei; Yanming Wang; Liying Yang
abstract: We introduce a new subgroup embedding property of finite groups called c-normal embedding. By using this embedding property, formation theory and some special techniques, we obtain `iff' versions of theorems of It√¥, Buckley, Srinivasan and other related results on p-nilpotence, nilpotence and supersolvability.

title: Automorphism Group of a Class of Gradation Shifting Toroidal Lie Algebras
authors: Xia Zhang-sheng; Shaobin Tan; Haifeng Lian
abstract: Let [Formula: see text] be the ring of Laurent polynomials in commuting variables. As a generalization of the toroidal Lie algebra, the gradation shifting toroidal Lie algebra [Formula: see text] is isomorphic to the corresponding (centerless) toroidal Lie algebra so(n, ‚ÑÇ) ‚®Ç A of type B or D as a vector space, with the Lie bracket twisted by n fixed elements E 1 ,‚Ä¶,E n from A. In this paper, we study the automorphisms of the gradation shifting toroidal algebra [Formula: see text], which is proved to be closely related to a class of subgroups of GL(n,‚Ñ§), called the linear groups over semilattices. We use the linear group over a special semilattice to determine the automorphism group of the gradation shifting toroidal algebra [Formula: see text], which extends our earlier work.

title: <font>co</font>-‚àó<sup>n</sup>-modules
abstract: It is well known that the notion of ‚àó-modules plays an important role in the generalization of Morita equivalences. Recently, Wei et al. introduced the concept of ‚àó n -modules, which induces an equivalence of particular subcategories. In this paper, the dual situation of ‚àó n -modules, called co -‚àó n -modules, is considered, and their characterizations and properties are derived. We also present a characterization in terms of category duality, which can be regarded as a generalization of Morita duality. In particular, it is found that the co -selfsmall n-cotilting modules are co -‚àó n -modules.

title: Groups with Finiteness Conditions on Commutators
authors: Maria De Falco; Francesco de Giovanni; Carmela Musella
abstract: The structure of groups for which certain sets of commutator subgroups are finite is investigated. In particular, the relation between such groups and groups with finite conjugacy classes of elements is discussed.

title: The Preimage of a Coordinate
abstract: Let K be a field of characteristic zero. Based on the degree estimate of Makar-Limanov and Yu, we prove that the preimage of a coordinate under an injective endomorphism of K„Äàx, y„Äâ is also a coordinate. As by-products, we give new proofs of the following results: (1) the preimage of a coordinate under an injective endomorphism of K[x,y] is also a coordinate; (2) any automorphism of K[x,y] or K„Äàx, y„Äâ is tame.

title: On Braided Lie Structures of Algebras in the Categories of Weak Hopf Bimodules
abstract: Let H be a weak Hopf algebra. In this paper, it is proved that the monoidal category [Formula: see text] of weak Hopf bimodules studied in Wang [19] is equivalent to the monoidal category [Formula: see text] of weak Yetter‚ÄìDrinfel'd modules introduced in B√∂hm [2]. When H has a bijective antipode, a braiding in the category [Formula: see text] is constructed by the braiding on [Formula: see text], generalizing the main result in Schauenburg [14]. Finally, the braided Lie structures of an algebra A in the category [Formula: see text] are investigated, by showing that if A is a sum of two braided commutative subalgebras, then the braided commutator ideal of A is nilpotent.

title: A Classification of 2-Finite Diagrams
abstract: In this article, we give a classification of 2-finite diagrams by explicitly describing all diagrams of types A, B and D, and by listing all 2-finite diagrams of other types.

title: Nilpotent Elements and Skew Polynomial Rings
